apis.description:
Retrieve the list of appointment groups that can be reserved or managed by
the current user.

operations.notes:
Retrieve the list of appointment groups that can be reserved or managed by
the current user.

parameters.name: scope
parameters.description: Defaults to "reservable"

parameters.name: context_codes
parameters.description: Array of context codes used to limit returned results.

parameters.name: include_past_appointments
parameters.description: Defaults to false. If true, includes past appointment groups

parameters.name: include
parameters.description:
Array of additional information to include.

"appointments":: calendar event time slots for this appointment group
"child_events":: reservations of those time slots
"participant_count":: number of reservations
"reserved_times":: the event id, start time and end time of reservations
                   the current user has made)
"all_context_codes":: all context codes associated with this appointment group

apis.description:
Create and return a new appointment group. If new_appointments are
specified, the response will return a new_appointments array (same format
as appointments array, see "List appointment groups" action)

operations.notes:
Create and return a new appointment group. If new_appointments are
specified, the response will return a new_appointments array (same format
as appointments array, see "List appointment groups" action)

parameters.name: appointment_group[context_codes]
parameters.description:
Array of context codes (courses, e.g. course_1) this group should be
linked to (1 or more). Users in the course(s) with appropriate permissions
will be able to sign up for this appointment group.

parameters.name: appointment_group[sub_context_codes]
parameters.description:
Array of sub context codes (course sections or a single group category)
this group should be linked to. Used to limit the appointment group to
particular sections. If a group category is specified, students will sign
up in groups and the participant_type will be "Group" instead of "User".

parameters.name: appointment_group[title]
parameters.description: Short title for the appointment group.

parameters.name: appointment_group[description]
parameters.description: Longer text description of the appointment group.

parameters.name: appointment_group[location_name]
parameters.description: Location name of the appointment group.

parameters.name: appointment_group[location_address]
parameters.description: Location address.

parameters.name: appointment_group[publish]
parameters.description:
Indicates whether this appointment group should be published (i.e. made
available for signup). Once published, an appointment group cannot be
unpublished. Defaults to false.

parameters.name: appointment_group[participants_per_appointment]
parameters.description:
Maximum number of participants that may register for each time slot.
Defaults to null (no limit).

parameters.name: appointment_group[min_appointments_per_participant]
parameters.description:
Minimum number of time slots a user must register for. If not set, users
do not need to sign up for any time slots.

parameters.name: appointment_group[max_appointments_per_participant]
parameters.description: Maximum number of time slots a user may register for.

parameters.name: appointment_group[new_appointments][X]
parameters.description:
Nested array of start time/end time pairs indicating time slots for this
appointment group. Refer to the example request.

parameters.name: appointment_group[participant_visibility]
parameters.description:
"private":: participants cannot see who has signed up for a particular
            time slot
"protected":: participants can see who has signed up.  Defaults to
              "private".

apis.description: Returns information for a single appointment group

operations.notes: Returns information for a single appointment group

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID

parameters.name: include

apis.description:
Return the next appointment available to sign up for. The appointment
is returned in a one-element array. If no future appointments are
available, an empty array is returned.

operations.notes:
Return the next appointment available to sign up for. The appointment
is returned in a one-element array. If no future appointments are
available, an empty array is returned.

parameters.name: appointment_group_ids
parameters.description: List of ids of appointment groups to search.

Appointment.description: Date and time for an appointment

id.description: The ID of the appointment group

title.description: The title of the appointment group

start_at.description: The start of the first time slot in the appointment group

end_at.description: The end of the last time slot in the appointment group

description.description: The text description of the appointment group

location_name.description: The location name of the appointment group

location_address.description: The address of the appointment group's location

participant_count.description: The number of participant who have reserved slots (see include[] argument)

reserved_times.description: The start and end times of slots reserved by the current user as well as the id of the calendar event for the reservation (see include[] argument)

context_codes.description: The context codes (i.e. courses) this appointment group belongs to. Only people in these courses will be eligible to sign up.

sub_context_codes.description: The sub-context codes (i.e. course sections and group categories) this appointment group is restricted to

workflow_state.description: Current state of the appointment group ('pending', 'active' or 'deleted'). 'pending' indicates that it has not been published yet and is invisible to participants.

requiring_action.description: Boolean indicating whether the current user needs to sign up for this appointment group (i.e. it's reservable and the min_appointments_per_participant limit has not been met by this user).

appointments_count.description: Number of time slots in this appointment group

appointments.description: Calendar Events representing the time slots (see include[] argument) Refer to the Calendar Events API for more information

new_appointments.description: Newly created time slots (same format as appointments above). Only returned in Create/Update responses where new time slots have been added

max_appointments_per_participant.description: Maximum number of time slots a user may register for, or null if no limit

min_appointments_per_participant.description: Minimum number of time slots a user must register for. If not set, users do not need to sign up for any time slots

participants_per_appointment.description: Maximum number of participants that may register for each time slot, or null if no limit

participant_visibility.description: 'private' means participants cannot see who has signed up for a particular time slot, 'protected' means that they can

participant_type.description: Indicates how participants sign up for the appointment group, either as individuals ('User') or in student groups ('Group'). Related to sub_context_codes (i.e. 'Group' signups always have a single group category)

url.description: URL for this appointment group (to update, delete, etc.)

html_url.description: URL for a user to view this appointment group

created_at.description: When the appointment group was created

updated_at.description: When the appointment group was last updated
